channel.title: Half-life 1 on the HIGHEST settings possible preview
channel.description:
Ever wondered how the original half-life looks with the HIGHEST resolution, textures, shadows etc?
I modified the mat_picmip to -10 and all setting were set on highest, which gives you the highest quality texture you can get. Also, I download a high resolution pack to make some textures seem better.
These picture were taken using HL1: Source. Also, soon I will make a video.
[url]https://hdimage.org/viewer.php?file=eno077vpp6orohl2r2.bmp[/url] [url]https://hdimage.org/viewer.php?file=e7qe619pcvu2bksqsdv.bmp[/url] [url]https://hdimage.org/viewer.php?file=lohc2i21w9sb6qvgg6.bmp[/url]
NOTE: A.A is on the highest (May seem low because picture is confined to a small square) To see the HD picture, click on the image and download.
What do you think?

item.title: Half-life 1 on the HIGHEST settings possible preview
item.dc:creator: YourArcenist
item.description:
They have this great thing called Black Mesa Source! And, It’s pretty much that times 1200!

But you never heard about it.

Move along.

item.title: Half-life 1 on the HIGHEST settings possible preview
item.dc:creator: TheDragonMask
item.description:
Redhotpengy:

Wait, I’m a little confused on HOW I download it. I download “Subversion” but I don’t know what to do now :S

Sorry about the long wait, I was going through my posts, and saw you asked about this. First of all, what is “subversion” I’ve never heard of that mod and as far as I know the linked thread is just a compilation of graphics enhancement mods for the original HL that ports them to HL:S. Second of all, I think you put it in your Half Life: Source folder. (its been a while since I installed it.) Also, DON’T FORGET TO BACK UP YOUR HL:S FOLDER. Reply if you are having trouble still.

Read full topic

item.source: Half-life 1 on the HIGHEST settings possible preview

item.title: Half-life 1 on the HIGHEST settings possible preview
item.dc:creator: Redhotpengy
item.description:
Maxey:

I don’t like most of the hi-res texture packs they make for old games. Either the new textures just look wrong on the old style geometry or the texture artists are idiots and just make bigger versions of the old textures without updating its style. Only in a few rare occasions, the new hi-res textures actually improve the overall visuals of the game (ex: Deus Ex hi-res pack).

That’s why I prefer old games to look old. It just adds to the style.

Yes, same here. I was just showing people what half life is capible of, even though I donwloaded a HD texture and model pack

Read full topic
item.source: Half-life 1 on the HIGHEST settings possible preview

item.title: Half-life 1 on the HIGHEST settings possible preview
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
I find that I get almost the exact same graphical quality when using OpenGL vs Direct3D, but about two to five times better framerate.

Also, I’ve always run HL1 at 1440x900 and opengl, so the high resolution isn’t really impressing me at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-life 1 on the HIGHEST settings possible preview
item.dc:creator: Redhotpengy
item.description:
TheDragonMask:

That looks like Diamond’s mod, https://www.moddb.com/mods/diamond-half-life-final. I use that mod for opposing force and blue shift, but unfortunately it doesn’t work with HL:S. Thankfully there is ANOTHER mod that works for HL:S that uses models from this. The only problem is that the weapons seem to be too far in front of Gordon. You can download it here https://www.facepunch.com/showthread.php?t=738169.

[WARNING]You need an svn program to download it, enjoy!

Forget this post

Read full topic
